title: Basics Scientific Notation Challenge
description: Master the art of converting numbers to and from scientific notation!

questions.question: The speed of light is approximately $3 \times 10^8$ \frac{m}{s}. How far does light travel in $2 \times 10^{-6}$ seconds?

The mass of an electron is approximately $9.11 \times 10^{-31}$ kg. The mass of a proton is approximately $1.67 \times 10^{-27}$ kg. How many times larger is the proton's mass than the electron's mass (approximately)?
The population of a city is $1.5 \times 10^6$. If $2 \times 10^5$ people move out, what is the new population?
A cell has a diameter of $1.2 \times 10^{-5}$ meters. A virus has a diameter of $6 \times 10^{-8}$ meters. How many times larger is the cell than the virus?
A computer processes $5 \times 10^9$ instructions per second. How many instructions can it process in $1.5 \times 10^2$ seconds?
The average distance from Earth to the Moon is $3.84 \times 10^8$ meters. If a spacecraft travels at $1.2 \times 10^4$ meters per second, how long would it take to reach the Moon?
A bacterial colony contains $5.0 \times 10^7$ bacteria. If the population doubles every hour, how many bacteria will there be after 2 hours?
A factory produces $2.5 \times 10^4$ units per day. If they operate for $2 \times 10^2$ days, how many units are produced in total?
The human body contains about $5 \times 10^6$ red blood cells per microliter. If a person has $5 \times 10^3$ microliters of blood, how many red blood cells are in their body?

The diameter of the Earth is about $1.27 \times 10^7$ meters. The diameter of a human hair is about $1 \times 10^{-4}$ meters. How many times larger is the Earth's diameter than a human hair's diameter?
If a star is $4.5 \times 10^{16}$ meters away and light travels at $3 \times 10^8$ \frac{m}{s}, how many years does it take for light to reach Earth? (1 year $\approx 3.15 \times 10^7$ seconds)
The mass of the Earth is approximately $5.97 \times 10^{24}$ kg. The mass of the Moon is approximately $7.35 \times 10^{22}$ kg. What is their combined mass?
A light-year is approximately $9.46 \times 10^{15}$ meters. How many light-years is $1.892 \times 10^{17}$ meters?
The human brain has about $8.6 \times 10^{10}$ neurons. If each neuron has $10^3$ connections, what is the total number of connections?
The diameter of a red blood cell is approximately $7.5 \times 10^{-6}$ meters. How many red blood cells would fit across a $1.5$ meter desk?
The mass of a dust particle is $7.5 \times 10^{-10}$ kg. If there are $2 \times 10^{12}$ dust particles in a room, what is the total mass of dust?
The Earth's population is about $8 \times 10^9$ people. If each person consumes $2 \times 10^3$ calories per day, how many total calories are consumed per day?
A microchip has $5 \times 10^9$ transistors. If a new technology allows for $1.5 \times 10^2$ times more transistors, how many transistors would the new chip have?
The mass of a proton is $1.67 \times 10^{-27}$ kg. If a nucleus has $5 \times 10^2$ protons, what is the total mass of the protons in the nucleus?
A supercomputer can perform $1.5 \times 10^{18}$ floating-point operations per second (FLOPS). How many operations can it perform in $1.0 \times 10^3$ seconds?
